title.narrative: RWI Cap dev within human rights 2015-2018

description.narrative: Objectives as defined after revision of programme and cost-extension in May 2018 Programme objective: Strengthened human rights performance of targeted actors enabling more informed and inclusive reform initiatives, policies and programmes in Turkey. Target area 1 objective: To strengthen institutional capacity for human rights education at targeted institutions. Expected Outcome for Target Area 1: Human rights education of high quality increasingly provided at targeted institutions in a manner promoting gender equality. Target area 2 objective: To strengthen networking and gender-integrated research capacity among human rights researchers. Expected Outcome for Target Area 2: Increased availability and accessibility of high quality gender-integrated human rights research and related policy recommendations of key relevance to the Turkish context. Target area 3 objective: To strengthen interaction between academic institutions, municipalities, state actors, private sector actors and civil society organisations to improve human rights work to meet rights-holders’ claims from an inclusion and gender perspective. Expected Outcome for Target Area 3: Strengthened interaction between academic institutions, municipalities, state actors, private sector actors and civil society organisations improving human rights work to meet rights-holders’ claims from an inclusion and gender perspective.
Strengthened human rights performance of targeted actors enabling more informed and inclusive reform initiatives, policies and programmes in Turkey.
Stärkt mänskliga rättigheter bland partners, för att generera mer informerade reform initiativ och program in Turkiet.

tag.narrative: 11.7 - By 2030, provide universal access to safe, inclusive and accessible, green and public spaces, in particular for women and children, older persons and persons with disabilities.

11.7 - Senast 2030 tillhandahålla universell tillgång till säkra, inkluderande och tillgängliga grönområden och offentliga platser, i synnerhet för kvinnor och barn, äldre personer och personer med funktionsnedsättning.
16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
17.17 - Encourage and promote effective public, public-private and civil society partnerships, building on the experience and resourcing strategies of partnerships
17.17 - Encourage and promote effective public, public-private and civil society partnerships, building on the experience and resourcing strategies of partnerships.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Summarized results are being based on the fact that RWI had to amend its results framework in 2017 due to post 2016 developments in Turkey. Therefore a division of results between 2015 to mid-2017 and mid-2017 to 30 June 2019 has been made (end of activity period). This is how the final report is formed, and seen as reasonable by Sida because of the impact the events had on the programme. During the first period, RWI worked with political and civil rights, and for the second period with empowering rights holders from an economic and social perspective (e.g. elderly, refugees, children, disabled etc.). This is an adaptation made by RWI because of the new operating environment post 2016 in Turkey. During 2015 to mid-2017, results are limited due to loss of partners, even though there are minor achievements that RWI built on during the second period of the programme. One example is the roll out of the Clinical Legal Education as a method as well as the establishment of the network of human rights researchers and the empowerment of this platform. For example, one activity that had to be cancelled was the support to the police academy in human rights. For the second period, examples of results mentioned here are being elaborated under respective target area. Under the first target area, RWI succeeded to provide courses in women human rights and the rights of elderly people. As one of RWIs methods is networking, this could be seen as an achievement in itself by bridging actors together from various field such as linking the academia with the BAR association and fostering collaboration across sectors. Examples of empowered universities are Atilim, Bogazic, Öyzegin and Akdeniz university as RWI have aimed to reach out to metropolitan universities as well as rural ones in Anatolia, to diversify beneficiaries geographically. Course material has also been developed and institutionalized into some universities. Under the second target area, RWI has been able to promote research on disadvantaged and neglected groups into the syllabus (for instance studies on disability rights has slightly increased due to RWI efforts) by supporting universities and individual scholars (junior and senior ones) by awarding scholarships and grants, tied to understudied areas. Other achievements for example is the establishment of sub-branches within universities focusing around understudied areas. Under the third target area, RWI have contributed to putting policy makers, academia and civil society together at the same table to discuss and reach progress among the rights of neglected groups such as dissability, refugees and elderly. For instance, Muratpasa municipality has established an elderly assembly and Sahinbey municipality has organized social kitchen to ease the social tensions between Turkish host communities and Syrian refugees. RWI is building on and striving to consolidate some of the results mentioned under a new programme from July 2019 to December 2020 with similar objectives.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
